Detailed Description

Implementation of interrupt related functions.

 MODIFICATION HISTORY:
 Ver   Who  Date     Changes
 ----- ---- -------- -------------------------------------------------------
 1.00a jz   08/16/10 First release
 2.00a jz   12/10/10 Added support for direct register access mode, v3 core
 2.01a jz   01/19/11 Added ability to re-assign BD addresses
 4.01a srt  06/13/12 Modified the logic of Error handling in interrupt
		      handlers.
 4.06a srt  04/09/13 Added API XAxiVdma_MaskS2MMErrIntr which will mask
		      the S2MM interrupt for the error mask provided.
		      (CR 734741)

Function Documentation

void XAxiVdma_IntrClear ( XAxiVdma *  InstancePtr,
u32  IntrType,
u16  Direction 
)

Clear the pending interrupts specified by the bit mask

Interrupts not specified by the mask will not be affected

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
Direction is the DMA channel, use XAXIVDMA_READ or XAXIVDMA_WRITE
IntrType is the bit mask for the interrups to be cleared
Returns:
None
Note:
If channel is invalid, then nothing is done
void XAxiVdma_IntrDisable ( XAxiVdma *  InstancePtr,
u32  IntrType,
u16  Direction 
)

Disable specific interrupts for a channel

Interrupts not specified by the mask will not be affected

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
IntrType is the bit mask for the interrups to be disabled
Direction is the DMA channel, use XAXIVDMA_READ or XAXIVDMA_WRITE
Returns:
None
Note:
If channel is invalid, then nothing is done

u32  IntrType,
u16  Direction 
)

Enable specific interrupts for a channel

Interrupts not specified by the mask will not be affected

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
Direction is the DMA channel, use XAXIVDMA_READ or XAXIVDMA_WRITE
IntrType is the bit mask for the interrups to be enabled
Returns:
None
Note:
If channel is invalid, then nothing is done
u32 XAxiVdma_IntrGetPending ( XAxiVdma *  InstancePtr,
u16  Direction 
)

Get the pending interrupts of a channel

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
Direction is the DMA channel, use XAXIVDMA_READ or XAXIVDMA_WRITE
Returns:
The bit mask for the currently pending interrupts
Note:
If Direction is invalid, return 0
int XAxiVdma_MaskS2MMErrIntr ( XAxiVdma *  InstancePtr,
u32  ErrorMask,
u16  Direction 
)

Masks the S2MM error interrupt for the provided error mask value

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the XAxiVdma instance to operate on
ErrorMask is the mask of error bits for which S2MM error interrupt can be disabled.
Direction is the channel to work on, use XAXIVDMA_READ/WRITE
Returns:
- XST_SUCCESS, when error bits are cleared.
  • XST_INVALID_PARAM, when channel pointer is invalid.
  • XST_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND, when the channel is not valid.
Note:
The register S2MM_DMA_IRQ_MASK is only applicable from IPv6.01a which is added at offset XAXIVDMA_S2MM_DMA_IRQ_MASK_OFFSET. For older versions, this offset location is reserved and so the API does not have any effect.
void XAxiVdma_ReadIntrHandler ( void *  InstancePtr  ) 

Interrupt handler for the read channel

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
Returns:
None
Note:
If the channel is invalid, then no interrupt handling
int XAxiVdma_SetCallBack ( XAxiVdma *  InstancePtr,
u32  HandlerType,
void *  CallBackFunc,
void *  CallBackRef,
u16  Direction 
)

Set call back function and call back reference pointer for one channel

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
HandlerType is the interrupt type that this callback handles
CallBackFunc is the call back function pointer
CallBackRef is the call back reference pointer
Direction is the DMA channel, use XAXIVDMA_READ or XAXIVDMA_WRITE
Returns:
  • XST_SUCCESS if everything is fine
  • XST_INVALID_PARAM if the handler type or direction invalid
Note:
This function overwrites the existing interrupt handler and its reference pointer. The function sets the handlers even if the channels are invalid.
void XAxiVdma_WriteIntrHandler ( void *  InstancePtr  ) 

Interrupt handler for the write channel

Parameters:
InstancePtr is the pointer to the DMA engine to work on
Returns:
None
Note:
If the channel is invalid, then no interrupt handling
